intro: Melampyrum lineare var. latifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf yellow false nettle, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and grasslands. Its leaves are lanceolate to ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface, and it produces clusters of yellowish-orange flowers. The species is characterized by its slender stems and is often found in association with other shade-tolerant flora.
